catalog_info.title: Measurements of the Mind: The Creation and Critique of the Psychological Test
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Introduces the history of psychological tests, from the perspective of the psychologists using them, the people tested, and the general public. Examines the creativity within psychology in the making of such tests, as well as the drawbacks and dangers of the (mis)uses of these instruments. Explores tests in current use, as well as tests contained in various Harvard archives. Final project for this seminar involves the design of an original psychological test.
